title: MacRostie 2014 Manzana Vineyard Pinot Noir (Green Valley)
description: This is a big, meaty wine that wears its youthfulness on its sleeve, showing a touch of reduction and assertive oak. Beneath its wall of ripeness, black licorice, cherry and pomegranate characteristics are buoyed by a depth of thick tannin.

title: Le Clos de Beau-Père 2014  Pomerol
description: This is a ripe complete wine. With its tannins and rich structure balanced by the generous black fruits, it has weight. Cut by the acidity of the vintage, this is serious, complex and worthy of aging. Drink from 2022.

title: Hugel 2014 Cuvée Les Amours Pinot Blanc (Alsace)
description: Crisp notes of freshly peeled pear mingle with a creamier aspect on the nose. The palate is a similarly appetizing and attractive mix of crisp freshness and creamy roundness. The body is very light but clean. The finish shines with fresh lemon.

title: I Veroni 2007  Vin Santo del Chianti Rufina
description: Made of 60% Malvasia, 30% Trebbiano and 10% Sangiovese, this opens with apricot and orange jam aromas. The warm, structured palate delivers toasted almond, chestnut honey and dried fig flavors. Drink through 2025.

title: Matias Wines 2014 Chardonnay (Santa Lucia Highlands)
description: This bottling from Brack Mountain Wine Company shows butter, sea salt and caramel on the nose, balanced by tangerine and faint jasmine aromas. The wine is elegant and easy to like, with Meyer lemon and prominent-but-not- overpowering honey butter on the palate, and a pink lemonade touch that carries into the finish.

title: Siduri 2014 Lingenfelder Vineyard Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
description: This wine is bright and crisp in strawberry and red licorice flavors, with a depth of juicy plum that adds softness and velvety texture. Tawdry earth complements the exuberant fruit.

title: Viñedos de Paganos 2013 La Nieta  (Rioja)
description: Typically dark in color, with plum, blackberry and a touch of raisin on the nose, this feels a bit jammy, with a shock of acidity and hard tannins. Prune, baked plum and baking-spice flavors finish toasty and charred, with dry rough tannins. Drink through 2025.

title: Tenuta Sette Cieli 2013 Scipio Red (Toscana)
description: Made entirely from Cabernet Franc, this offers blueberry, cedar and bell pepper aromas. The palate is juicy, full of red currant, vanilla and Mediterranean herb flavors, held firm with polished tannins and a tart finish. Drink through 2022.

title: Von Strasser 2013 Estate Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Diamond Mountain District)
description: Raspberry and cranberry flavors and a twist of cinnamon stick accent the firm tannins of this estate wine, marked by classic red currant, cedar and dried herb notes. Medium-bodied and modest in oak, it shows a clarity of crisp acidity.

title: Tenuta di Capraia 2011 Effe 55 Gran Selezione  (Chianti Classico)
description: The subtle nose of this all-Sangiovese wine suggests ripe black-skinned fruit, pressed violets and dark spices. The linear palate offers dried black cherry, licorice, clove and chopped herb flavors, pulled taut by firm, fine-grained tannins that lead to a coffee-inflected finish.

title: Tenuta Friggiali 2012  Brunello di Montalcino
description: Woodland berry, tobacco and cooking spice aromas emerge in the glass. The medium-bodied, already approachable palate doles out juicy black cherry, star anise and white pepper notes, with a frame of ripe, tightly knit tannins. Enjoy 2018–2022.

title: Fesstivity 2014 Brut Cuvée Sparkling (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: This blend of 60% Pinot Noir and 40% Chardonnay from the Fess Parker team offers lemon blossom, baking soda and lime zest aromas on the light and flowery nose. Broad flavors of yellow apple and pear meet with a citrus twist on the finish.

title: Fabbioli Cellars 2012 Reserve Cabernet Franc (Virginia)
description: This beauty is rich in raspberry and blackberry leaf aromas on the nose, which carry through to the palate and are joined by flavors of kirsch, clove, lavender and tobacco. Well integrated tannins and bright acidity lead to a long, smoky finish.

title: Fattoi 2012  Brunello di Montalcino
description: Grilled herb, dark spice, forest floor, toast and oak aromas lead the nose. The palate is dense, its mature black cherry, espresso, licorice and tobacco flavors drawn tight with close-grained tannins that leave a compact finish. Drink 2022–2027.

title: Wrath 2014 Swan/828 Pinot Noir (Monterey)
description: A strongly herbal take on the grape, this clonal combo shows bay leaf, eucalyptus and tarry earth notes on the nose. The palate kicks off with a red plum tang, settling into cranberry -inflected fruit before pine needle-laced forest floor flavors emerge with herbaceous power.

title: Wynns Coonawarra Estate 2013 Black Label Cabernet Sauvignon (Coonawarra)
description: This is a full-bodied, rich and round Cabernet Sauvignon. Juicy, mouthwatering cassis fruit is framed by cedar, vanilla and baking spices, while the finish showcases fine tannins. Given the quality of this wine, it's a shame that Wynns' high-end john Riddoch Cab doesn't get exported to the U.S.

title: Yalumba 2015 Made With Organic Grapes Chardonnay (South Australia)
description: This is a medium-bodied, richly textured Chardonnay that deserves a place on any table. Grilled pineapple and peach notes convey ripeness without excessive oak or weight, finishing long and plush. Drink now–2020.

title: Willamette Valley Vineyards 2014 Tualatin Estate Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)
description: Dijon and Pommard clones blend gracefully here, pushing sweet cherry fruit and baking spices into the flavor center. A touch of fresh-baked pie crust lingers also, and this easy-drinking cuvée should be enjoyed now through 2020.

title: Cantina del Giusto 2012 Baradiero  (Vino Nobile di Montepulciano)
description: Leather, underbrush, grilled herb and charred earth aromas take center stage, accented by a balsamic note. The structured, medium-bodied palate offers juicy black cherry, coffee, licorice and rosemary flavors, framed by firm, fine-grained tannins. Drink or hold a few more years.

title: Château Ampélia 2016 Barrel Sample  (Castillon Côtes de Bordeaux)
description: 89–91. Barrel Sample. While there are lots of spicy wood tones in this full, ripe wine, the fruit lends grounding balance. Black currant flavors and firm tannins give it good potential for the future.

title: Château du Retout 2014  Haut-Médoc
description: With an unusually high proportion (nearly 17%) of Petit Verdot in the blend, this is both darkly structured and dark in color. It is weight, intense youthful acidity and black-currant fruits. It's also rich, full of tannins and in need of several years. Drink from 2021.

title: Château Ducluzeau 2014  Listrac-Médoc
description: Owned by the Borie family, one of the grand families of Bordeaux, the vineyard forms part of Château Fourcas-Borie. The wine, with its dark tannins and dense texture, is powerful and concentrated. Layers of tannins show most strongly at this young stage, while the ripe juicy fruit will develop well. It is going to be a fine wine. Drink from 2021.

title: Château La Clare 2014  Médoc
description: From one of a group of chateaus owned by the Guyon family of Rolland de By, this is an intensely fruity wine. It has finely balanced tannins and acidity along with smoky flavors and layers of delicious black currant fruit. Drink from 2019.

title: Château la Vieille Cure 2014  Fronsac
description: With signs of its wood aging that are balanced with firm tannins and concentrated black fruits, this is a solid wine, packed with tannins. There is a touch of dark chocolate as well as the ripe fruit. It is a fine wine, ready to drink from 2020.

title: 2Hawk 2015 Viognier (Rogue Valley)
description: This estate-grown, pure varietal effort is exceptionally rich and succulent. The flavors of sugared grapefruit, lemon pulp and rind and sweet tea are concentrated and lingering. Despite the impression of sweetness, it's not a dessert wine, just an especially ripe and rich one.

title: Abacela NV Vintner's Blend #16 Red (Umpqua Valley)
description: Roughly half estate-grown Tempranillo, this smooth and deeply-fruited red includes small amounts of 10 other grapes. For all that it's complete, complex and composed, with pomegranate jam, loganberries, polished tannins and prolonged power. Drink now through 2020.

title: Allimant-Laugner 2015 Sylvaner (Alsace)
description: The lovely fruity-green notion of lemon balm appears on the nose and shimmers with its own subtlety. The wonderfully slender, almost playful, palate is translucent in its freshness and shimmering citrus and herb character. What a lovely subtle wine. Enjoy with equally subtle food.

title: Alma Rosa 2015 El Jabali Vineyard Chardonnay (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: El Jabali—the home vineyard of vintners Richard and Thekla Sanford—delivers a Chardonnay loaded with fresh lemongrass, nectarine and Gravenstein apple scents. There is a pithy grip to the palate, where apple and Anjou pear flavors converge with lime and grapefruit tartness.

title: Ancient Oak Cellars 2014 Kent Ritchie Vineyard Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)
description: This reserve-series wine opens in honeysuckle, offering a wealth of floral aromas before unveiling a backbone of caramel oak. Starting fresh and crisp in acidity and citrus, it evolves in the glass to become richer and more unctuous in texture, with a boldness of baked apple.

title: Antoine Moltès & Fils 2015 Zinnkoepfle Grand Cru Gewurztraminer (Alsace)
description: Sweet, rich and generously sunny peach notes on the nose and the tongue have top notes of honeysuckle. On the palate, the lusciousness is countered and given direction by orange peel freshness. This is all primary and still opulent, brimming with flavors. The finish is medium sweet.
